title: Pembrokeshire death: Gerald Capelin, 57, named as diver
article: A diver who died after getting into difficulty off the coast has been officially named. Gerald Capelin, 57, from the Cardiff area, had been diving off the Pembrokeshire coast on Saturday, Dyfed-Powys Police confirmed. Although he was rescued from the water at St Brides by emergency services, including the RNLI, medics were unable to revive him. His family thanked emergency services and divers for trying to save him.
